statement:
If $a_1, a_2,\dotsc, a_{2n-1}$ is a set of integers, then there exists a
subset $a_{i_1}, a_{i_2},\dotsc,a_{i_n}$ of $n$ integers such that
$$a_{i_1}+ a_{i_2}+\dotsb+a_{i_n}\equiv 0 \pmod n.$$ The theorem is also
known as the EGZ theorem.
